decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing the Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to quickly win the game by flipping the library. It includes cards like Jace, Wielder of Mysteries and Dig Through Time to help with card advantage and searching for combo pieces. Protection and disruption come in the form of cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while Jace, Vryn's Prodigy helps with card selection and graveyard recursion. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to all necessary colors of mana.

The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creature threats. By utilizing aggressive creatures like Burning-Tree Emissary, Gruul Spellbreaker, and Questing Beast, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Supporting cards such as Lightning Strike and Domri, Anarch of Bolas provide additional removal and card advantage, while Klothys, God of Destiny helps to maintain a steady flow of resources. The deck's mana base is designed to ensure smooth and consistent access to all necessary colors of mana.

The deck focuses on using Niv-Mizzet Reborn as a powerful card advantage engine, while controlling the game with a mix of removal spells and versatile creatures. It aims to ramp into Niv-Mizzet Reborn quickly with cards like Gilded Goose and Sylvan Caryatid, and then utilize cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Bring to Light to control the board and find answers to opposing threats. The deck also includes a toolbox of cards like Slaughter Games and Thoughtseize to disrupt opponent's plans and secure the win.

The main focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly build a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures. By utilizing mana accelerants like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, the deck aims to play threats such as Ghalta, Primal Hunger and Steel Leaf Champion ahead of curve. Cards like Lovestruck Beast and Rotting Regisaur provide additional pressure, while Collected Company and The Great Henge offer card advantage and supplementary support. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Scrapheap Scrounger and Scavenging Ooze to handle opposing strategies.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive Spirit creatures with flying and utilizing them to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By buffing up the Spirits with Empyrean Eagle and Supreme Phantom, the deck aims to deal damage quickly while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Spell Queller. The deck also includes cards like Selfless Spirit and Nebelgast Herald to protect its creatures and maintain pressure on the opponent. With cards like Collected Company to generate card advantage, the deck aims to close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The key concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to flood the board with small creatures quickly, sacrifice them for value with cards like Woe Strider and Priest of Forgotten Gods, and drain the opponent's life with Zulaport Cutthroat triggers. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive plays and grind them down with incremental advantage from sacrificing creatures. The deck also utilizes cards like Collected Company and Gruesome Menagerie to keep up the pressure and maintain a steady stream of threats on the battlefield.

This Pioneer deck focuses on using small, evasive creatures to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By equipping them with enchantments like Curious Obsession and Staggering Insight, and protecting them with cards like Gods Willing and Reckless Rage, the deck aims to maintain card advantage and pressure the opponent. The inclusion of The Royal Scions provides additional card draw and buffing potential. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around aggressive attacks and maintaining tempo to overwhelm the opponent in a fast-paced game.

This aggressive Boros deck aims to overwhelm opponents with cheap creatures that benefit from combat tricks and protection spells. By utilizing cards like Feather, the Redeemed and Dreadhorde Arcanist to recur combat tricks, the deck can maintain pressure and protect its threats. With a focus on speed and resilience, this deck aims to continually apply pressure to opponents while protecting its own creatures from removal spells. By utilizing a mix of creatures that benefit from spells and a suite of combat tricks, this Boros Aggro deck aims to maintain aggression and outpace opponents in the Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to overrun the opponent with a fast and efficient creature-based strategy. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Shared Summons to quickly gather creatures, combined with powerful threats like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Walking Ballista, this deck can apply pressure early and maintain a strong battlefield presence. The deck also includes cards like Courser of Kruphix and Voice of Resurgence to provide additional value and resilience. Overall, the goal is to swarm the opponent with creatures and outpace them to secure a victory.

The focal point of this UW Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils, along with board wipes like Supreme Verdict, the deck aims to control the board and out-value the opponent. The deck also includes a variety of utility lands and card draw spells to ensure consistency and resilience. Ultimately, the goal is to establish dominance and dictate the flow of the game until victory is achieved.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's strategy by using a combination of removal spells, discard effects, and powerful control planeswalkers. By consistently removing threats and disrupting their hand, you can buy time to establish your own board presence with powerful creatures like Questing Beast and Ishkanah, Grafwidow. The inclusion of cards like Emrakul, the Promised End and Distended Mindbender allows you to seize control of the game in the late stages, while cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World provide additional ramp and card advantage to stay ahead of your opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells. By playing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Rabblemaster, combined with powerful burn spells like Lightning Strike and Wild Slash, the goal is to deal quick and consistent damage to the opponent. Cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Chandra, Torch of Defiance provide additional damage and utility to help secure victory. The deck aims to be proactive and relentless in its strategy, applying pressure from the beginning to force the opponent on the defensive.

The deck focuses on utilizing Lotus Field and various untap effects to generate large amounts of mana quickly, allowing for explosive combo turns. Arboreal Grazer and Fae of Wishes help accelerate the mana production while cards like Hidden Strings and Pore Over the Pages dig for key pieces. Underworld Breach enables card recursion and combo potential. The deck aims to assemble the combo pieces quickly, untap Lotus Field multiple times in a turn, and win the game with a big spell like Explosion or a powerful combo finish.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing powerful creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Goblin Rabblemaster, and Legion Warboss to apply pressure early in the game. The deck also supports this strategy with mana ramp from Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, along with card advantage and creature synergy from Collected Company. Cards like Rampaging Ferocidon and Embercleave provide additional ways to close out the game quickly, making this deck a formidable force in Pioneer 1 vs 1 matches.

Utilizing a variety of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful threats, this Sultai Control deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently deploying its own threats to close out the game. It focuses on ramping into powerful cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Emrakul, the Promised End, while controlling the board with cards like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay. By managing resources and maintaining a strong board presence, this deck can outvalue and outcontrol its opponents in a slow and grindy game.
